If there is a "refugee" crisis, it is primarily because of the closure of the borders, the virtual absence of legal channels and the lack of funding for reception and solidarity. So it's a matter of political choices. Following the Commission's proposals for relocation but also to support the countries of first reception in and outside the EU, the EU's 2015 budget had to be reviewed.  The proposal aims to increase emergency aid by 100 million euros, humanitarian aid by 55.7 million euros and to finance the relocation plan to the tune of 66.1 million euros. The GUE/NGL group and the Greens have tabled amendments to put in place safeguards, notably so that funding is not used for border security, but they have been rejected. However, the release of these funds is necessary: I have therefore voted for these emergency budget measures.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 Draft amending budget No 7/2015 provides for an increase in the number of posts on the organisation chart of FRONTEX, EASO and EUROPOL (120 in total), as well as the corresponding salary appropriations by the end of the year, amounting to EUR 1.3 million in commitments and payments. This is a positive element. However, because we do not agree with all aspects of european refugee policy and in particular the Common European Asylum System, we abstain from voting on this amending budget. Furthermore, we believe that the Union should make more efforts to manage the current migrant and refugee crisis and contribute to the stabilisation of countries of origin by assisting transit countries, as the proposed measures will certainly not be sufficient, given the seriousness of the problem.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. There is no support for an increase in the financial resources for the refugee problem, which will continue to address only the symptoms and not the causes of the problem. Parliament's willingness, mentioned in the report, to accept further application of the flexibility provisions if further increase is necessary is like a bottomless pit. The report lacks concrete measures that could contribute to a sustainable solution to the problem. I cannot therefore support this report.

name: Theodoros ZAGORAKIS
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 I supported the report on the amending budget on the management of the refugee crisis, which will provide for the adoption of immediate budgetary changes in order to implement the decisions of the informal European Council of 23 September on migration. The seven-year institutional framework of the EU budget clearly needs to be revised, as the refugee crisis is not a transient phenomenon.

name: Pablo ZALBA BIDEGAIN
text: in writing. The EU is experiencing a huge inlet of refugees, which has undoubtedly been mainly motivated by the situation in Syria. This situation has led to a mobilisation of people towards our borders that exceeds all expectations of immigration so far contemplated by the European Union. This has created great difficulties in a number of Member States, especially those which are refugee entry and transit areas. The measures put in place so far are insufficient. I therefore fully agree with the adoption of exceptional new measures, especially those relating to the increase in budget in this area, which will be very positive in helping all Member States (especially Greece, Hungary and Italy) manage such refugee entry.

name: Marco ZANNI
text: in writing. \u2012 Amending budget No 7 is concerned with allocating resources to deal with the migration crisis facing the EU on a massive scale for some months. The measures provided for in this amending period include, firstly, the strengthening of emergency assistance provided under the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund and the Internal Security Fund for a total amount of EUR 100 million in commitment appropriations and it is proposed to increase the number of posts for Frontex, EASO and Europol in order to increase their capacity to operate on the ground. Further funding is also provided for the European Neighbourhood Instrument, so that the EU Regional Trust Fund in response to the Syrian crisis can count on at least EUR 500 million and, finally, an increase of EUR 55.7 million is proposed in payment appropriations for humanitarian aid through realisation. This is certainly not a decisive measure, but one that we hope will help to try to improve the management of the migrant and refugee crisis at European level.

name: Tomáš ZDECHOVSKÝ
text: Writing. \u2012 I strongly support this proposal to amend the 2015 budget. In my opinion, these funds are properly spent. In particular, FRONTEX, EASO and EUROPOL need to be strengthened by the end of the year. Thanks to this approved increase, they will be able to cope better with the migration crisis. I am also very pleased that we have included more money in this proposal for non-EU countries, which are the target of most Syrian refugees. I consider these steps to be a step in the right direction, and I believe that it is precisely the focus on third countries outside the EU's borders that will contribute to a significant improvement in the migration crisis in the EU.

name: Kosma ZŁOTOWSKI
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The immigration crisis that has affliced Europe in recent months is based in the EU's neighbouring countries and should, above all, be resolved there. Concrete support is needed for our partners and allies in the Middle East, who are taking on the biggest wave of refugees from war-stricken regions. We need to make a financial effort to improve living conditions in refugee camps in Jordan, Lebanon and Turkey, which are struggling with overcrowding and the resulting problems. This can be achieved through cooperation with the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the World Food Programme. cooperation, which must also take the form of financial support for these institutions.  We should also do everything we can to strengthen control at our external borders. The images we have seen in Hungary can never happen again. I therefore fully support the transfer of appropriations under the EU budget for 2015 so that these objectives can be achieved as soon as possible. Decisive and consistent action at the EU's borders and in safe countries is really the only way to ensure the security of both genuine Syrian refugees fleeing the civil war and residents of the Member States, who must be sure that the European Union's external border is tight and secure.

name: Inês Cristina ZUBER
text: in writing. \u2012 This amending budget draft No 7/2015 provides for a strengthening of emergency assistance provided under the Asylum, Migration and Integration Fund (AMIF) and the Fund for Internal Security (ISF) totaling EUR 100 million in commitment appropriations as well as other programmes financed under the AMIF. It also provides for additional funding for the European Neighbourhood Instrument (totaling EUR 300 million) and an increase of EUR 55.7 million in appropriations for payments for humanitarian aid through redeployment. This draft amending budget is accompanied by a proposal for a decision on the mobilisation of the Flexibility Instrument for the provision of immediate budgetary measures under the European Agenda on Migration amounting to EUR 66.1 million. Unfortunately, it insists on the response through the militarisation of humanitarian aid, while also providing for an increase in the number of places in the organisation chart of FRONTEX, EASO and EUROPOL (120 in total). Given in this report that the Union should do more to manage the current migrant and refugee crisis, "contributing to the stabilisation of countries of origin", the EU's efforts to destabilise them never refer to them.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of suspending immunity to Béla Kovács as it is clearly a case of political persecution. The suspension of the immunity of an elected office so that it can deal with legal proceedings cannot be used as a political weapon against Members of the European Parliament. This is a clear case of instrumentalisation of this, which is why I did not vote in favour of suspending his immunity.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. Hungarian MEP Béla Kovacs is accused of spying for the Russian Federation.  He has never hidden his ties to Russia. But from there to say that he is a Russian spy, there is a chasm. From what we read on the subject, he is accused mainly of being pro-Russian and, as such, he is ipso facto an agent of influence in the pay of the Kremlin. The deduction is hasty to say the least. By reasoning in this way, many parliamentarians could be lifted their immunity for espionage for the benefit of the United States! I therefore voted against this request to waive immunity.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ This request for waiver is a hugely complex issue. Parliamentary immunity is provided for under the Rules of Procedure and, naturally, requests for waiver should be treated with sympathy where appropriate: being an elected MEP should not provide a ‘get out of jail free’ card. The request for waiver in this case appears to relate to the possibility of investigations. I feel, however, that I am unable to make a decision, not least because I am uncertain as to whether or not any of the investigation relates to matters of security and defence. I do not have sufficient information. Whilst supporting the rule of law, I want to be certain that actions for which waiver of immunity is sought are truly criminal in their nature.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. This Hungarian Member of Parliament is accused of spying in the service of Russia: he is clearly the victim of political persecution, and I would gladly call my colleagues to reason if this Parliament did not seem irretrievably plagued by a veritable anti-Russian hysteria.  We must put an end to this McCarthyism in Brussels.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I supported the lifting of Mr. Kovacs' immunity so that he could explain himself in court in his country in relation to the charges against him.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. Hungarian MP Béla Kovacs is likely to be the victim of political persecution accusing him of spying for Russia. I obviously voted against this request for parliamentary immunity.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. For several months, the Committee on Legal Affairs has discussed the case of MePS Béla Kovács for several months. The phases of the procedure set out in the Regulation (exchange of views, hearing and taking into account the draft report) have been strictly followed and there has also been a hearing with Hungarian authorities to deepen the case.  Following this process, the Committee on Legal Affairs voted mostly in favour of suspending immunity after ruling out that such a request should be entered in an open process with the intention of causing political harm to the Member. That's why I voted for it.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because it has been decided by Parliament to waive the immunity of Béla Kovács, a Hungarian Member of the European Parliament. The Hungarian Attorney General has requested the waiver of the immunity of this Member of the European Parliament so that, on the basis of reasonable suspicions, an investigation could be carried out to determine whether Mr Kovács will be charged with a spy offence against the EU institutions. The Hungarian Criminal Code provides that a person carrying out intelligence activities directed against the European Parliament, the European Commission or the Council of the European Union for the benefit of a non-MEMBER country is to be penalised in accordance with Article 261 thereof. The same Article of the Hungarian Criminal Code provides that a person carrying out an anti-Hungarian intelligence activity for the benefit of a foreign state or a foreign organisation shall commit a criminal offence punishable by imprisonment of between two and eight years.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this request for the waiver of Béla Kovács' parliamentary immunity because I believe that the offence for which he is accused does not under any circumstances fall within those covered by parliamentary immunity. Furthermore, I hope that the Institutions of the Union, as well as those of the Member States, will implement more effective measures to prevent a repeat of events such as those attributed to Mr De Clercq. Kovács.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. Bela Kovacs, AN MEP, is accused by Hungary's Attorney General of conducting intelligence activities against the European institutions for the benefit of Russia. This proposal is intended to lift his parliamentary immunity. On the one hand, these alleged accusations are part of his parliamentary activity. On the other hand, this Member seems to be the victim of persecution by the Hungarian justice system and the European Soviet Union. That is why I voted against the lifting of Bela Kovacs' parliamentary immunity.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 There is not enough merit to be able to take a clear position on this.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ This vote was concerned with a request for a parliamentary waiver for a Member of Parliament. The investigation appears to have been at least partially carried out by the intelligence services of Hungary, with no access to case documents for the defendant, which is a serious violation of the equality of arms principles in fair trials law. Moreover, there are a number of concerns which have been raised recently by the international legal community concerning the objectivity of Hungary’s judicial system which, it has been contended, has been interfered with by the use of Fidesz-dictated cardinal laws. Therefore, this raises serious doubts about the independence of the prosecution. It was for these reasons that I abstained on this vote.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this request because the relevant authorities should be able to investigate the very serious accusations faced by Mr Kovács in order for the situation to be cleared and resolved.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The request for waiver of the immunity of Hungarian MEP Béla Kovács will make it possible to carry out investigations aimed at ascertaining whether there may be a charge of espionage offences against the institutions of the European Union. Since it seems that there is no fumus persecutionis, that is to say, a sufficiently serious and precise indication that the case is brought before a court with the intention of politically harming the Member concerned, I voted in favour of the revocation.

name: Aymeric CHAUPRADE
text: In writing. The request to waive Mr. Béla Kovacs' parliamentary immunity was made following the charge of espionage for russia against him. I voted against this request because Mr Kovacs is clearly the victim of political persecution.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 Having regard to the report of the Committee on Legal Affairs, the waiver of the Immunity of the Mep is approved.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the request for the waiver of Béla Kovács' parliamentary immunity. On 3 July 2014, the President announced, pursuant to Rule 9(1) of the Rules of Procedure, that he had received a letter from the Hungarian Attorney General requesting the waiver of Béla Kovács' parliamentary immunity. The request for waiver of immunity shall be made in order to be able to carry out investigations, on the basis of reasonable suspicions, with a view to ascertaining whether there may be an allegation of the crime of espionage against the Institutions of the Union. Anyone carrying out intelligence activities against the European Parliament, the European Commission or the Council of the EU and Hungary on behalf of a foreign power is punishable by a prison sentence of between two and eight years, as provided for in the Hungarian Criminal Code. According to information provided by the Attorney General, Kovács has had secret contacts with Russian intelligence officials since 2010. The Prosecutor has made it clear that the investigation and any subsequent indictment for which the waiver of immunity is requested are limited to the events that occurred after January 1, 2014. Furthermore, there is no reason to suppose the existence of a fumus persecutionis.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 This is the proposal to waive the immunity of MEP Béla Kovács, requested by the Hungarian Attorney General in order to be able to carry out investigations, on the basis of reasonable suspicions, to determine whether there may be an allegation against him regarding the crime of espionage against the institutions of the European Union under Section 261/A of Law C of 2012 on the Hungarian Criminal Code. According to this section, anyone carrying out intelligence activities against the European Parliament, the European Commission or the Council of the European Union on behalf of a non-EU country is punishable in accordance with Section 261; Under Section 261(1), anyone carrying out intelligence activities against Hungary on behalf of a foreign power or foreign organisation is guilty of a criminal offence punishable by a prison sentence of between two and eight years. For the reasons given in the above presentation, I am voting in favour.

name: Pál CSÁKY
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report of the Committee on Legal Affairs referred to plenary on the waiver of the immunity of Béla Kovács jobbikos. The immunity case, which was followed by a great deal of media interest, was voted on in the European Parliament after a year and a half because of the requested postponements, so it is now in the hands of the Hungarian judiciary. The case is not specific and the EP has repeatedly complied with the request for immunity waived by the authorities of the Member States. Until a court judgment has been handed down, the Member shall not be restricted in the performance of his duties as a member of parliament.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. Attached to freedom of expression, I pay particular attention to the lifting of parliamentary immunity to the extent that it may be required for purely political and non-judicial reasons and based on tangible evidence. Our colleague Bela Kovacs is accused of spying on behalf of Russia. However, the evidence in the record does not support such an assertion. I was sure that political motives may have led to possible persecution, and I voted against this request for the lifting of parliamentary immunity.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 This case is an unprecedented form of political persecution, unprecedented for European data, based on a photographic law on alleged espionage against the European Parliament. Anyone who wants to "spy" on the European Parliament can go on their website and see all their documents posted for public viewing. The Orbán government is the only one in the EU that has politicised a non-existent offence, that of espionage against the EU, with the sole aim of beating its political opponents. As a movement that has suffered political persecution, but also the terrorism of the parastate, we stand in solidarity with those persecuted for their political spirit.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. The Hungarian Attorney General has requested the waiver of the immunity of a Member of the European Parliament, Béla Kovács, in order to open an investigation and is suspected of spying against the institutions of the European Union. According to the information provided by the Attorney General, Mr Kovács' secret contacts with Russian intelligence agents were first discovered in 2010 by the Hungarian Constitution Protection Service as part of an investigation into the activities of certain foreign nationals.  I agree with the waiver of Béla Kovács' immunity for the initiation of an investigation to determine whether she is charged with espionage against the institutions of the European Union.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I am voting for the application to waive the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovács, because this case is unprecedented, for European data, a form of political persecution based on a photographic law on alleged espionage against the European Parliament. Anyone who wants to "spy" on the EP can enter his website and see all his documents posted for public viewing. The Orbán Government is the only one in the EU that has politicised a non-existent offence, that of espionage against the EU, with the sole aim of beating its political opponents. As a movement that has suffered political persecution and the terrorism of the parastate, we stand in solidarity with those persecuted for their political spirit.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ The case was discussed in committee throughout several months in order to understand it in detail. All phases of the procedure were strictly followed according to the rules (exchange of views, hearing and consideration of draft report) and included as well a hearing of judicial Hungarian authorities. The report was voted in committee on Monday 12.10.2015, and according to the Rules of Procedure it needs to be put to the vote during the first plenary session following the committee vote. The JURI Committee, considering all conditions were met, voted to waive immunity. I voted in favour of waiving immunity.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. I abstained in this pleading for suspension of immunity. Although I understand that Béla Kovács does not represent in any case the values expected of this House, I also understand that the suspension of immunity cannot be equated to a political trial, so I abstained in this case.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the request for the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovács so that the MEP can deal with the judiciary in his country.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒  I have voted for the request for waiver of the immunity of Béla Kovács. The request for the waiver of the immunity of Béla Kovács is made in order that investigations can be carried out, on the basis of reasonable suspicions, to see whether a charge will lie against him with regard to the offence of espionage against the institutions of the European Union under Section 261/A of Act C of 2012 on the Hungarian Criminal Code.  According to that Section, any person who conducts intelligence activities for a non-European Union third country against the European Parliament, the European Commission or the Council of the European Union shall be punishable in accordance with Section 261, paragraph 1 of which provides that any person who conducts intelligence activities for a foreign power or foreign organisation against Hungary is guilty of a felony punishable by a term of imprisonment of between two and eight years.  This is a very serious allegation and it is our duty to remove any obstacles for the investigation and to clear the path for the right and just decision to be made.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. I abstained in this pleading for suspension of immunity. Although I understand that Béla Kovács does not represent in any case the values expected of this House, I also understand that the suspension of immunity cannot be equated to a political trial, so I abstained in this case.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒I voted for a proposal for a European Parliament resolution on a request to lift Beli Kovacs' immunity, as this is an alleged suspicion of a espionage offence to the detriment of the Institutions of the European Union. Moreover, there is no reasonable doubt that that claim was initiated with the intention of causing political harm. I therefore consider that an investigation should be carried out to establish whether doubts are well founded and whether the offence was actually committed and, accordingly, to proceed with any judicial process.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. Hungarian MEP Béla Kovacs is accused of spying on the Russian Federation.  Mr. Béla Kovacs pays for his patriotic commitment and is no more or less a victim of political persecution. Parliamentary immunity is a democratic tradition, the crumbling of which in recent times speaks volumes about the liberticidal state of the EU. I obviously voted against it.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Tadeusz Zwiefka's report on Bela Kovacs' request for the lifting of immunity. This procedure is a formality which, without deciding on the merits of the case, is intended to enable the judicial authorities to carry out their investigative work. The report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. The immunity of Mr Béla Kovacs is to be waived, as he is accused of spying against the EU institutions. The Hungarian Public Prosecutor's Office plans to open an investigation in this regard, as espionage activities are punishable by a third country. Unfortunately, the report itself does not give a description of the evidence or the exact facts, which is why I am abstaining.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the request as I agree with the reasons stated in the proposal to waive immunity.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. I voted against this lifting of parliamentary immunity because Bela Kovacs is accused of spying against the EU for the benefit of Russia. However, this is clearly a political persecution: the charge is empty and the law criminalising espionage against the EU was passed late. I am indifferent to the fact that Mr Kovacs belongs to the Jobbik, for which I have no particular sympathy. I would have voted the same regardless of his political affiliation.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of suspending immunity to Béla Kovács as it is clearly a case of political persecution. The suspension of the immunity of an elected office so that it can deal with legal proceedings cannot be used as a political weapon against Members of the European Parliament. This is a clear case of instrumentalisation of this, which is why I did not vote in favour of suspending his immunity.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ Béla Kovács is an independent Hungarian MEMBER of the European Parliament and a member of the Committee on Industry, Research and Energy and the Delegation for Relations with Japan and the Delegation to the Euronest Parliamentary Assembly. Hungary's attorney general has demanded the waiver of the mp's immunity so they can investigate him and decide to bring charges of espionage to the detriment of European Union institutions. I supported the report on the waiver of the immunity of Representative Béla Kovács because there is no doubt that the application was made with the intention of damaging political damage to the Member.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 Whether Mr. Kokovcha was a spy for the Russian Federation or not, he was prosecuted by the Hungarian Public Prosecutor's Office. Therefore, in order to be able to understand the truth or the truth of this accusation, as well as the reality of the case as a whole, a fair implementation of the judicial procedure is necessary.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the report on the request to waive the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovács following the positive recommendation of the European Parliament's Committee on Legal Affairs.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted against the request for the waiver of The immunity of Mr Béla Kovács because I believe that parliamentary immunity is not a personal privilege of a Member but a guarantee of the independence of Parliament and its Members as a super partes institution. I remain convinced that a guarantee line must be followed in these cases and i will therefore continue to vote against this type of report in defence of the institutional role conferred by this Parliament.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 On 3 July 2014, the President announced that he had received a request from the Hungarian Attorney-General for the waiver of Mr Styrene's immunity. Béla Kovács to establish the existence of an indictment against him. My vote in favour of the revocation does not express a judgment on the guilt or innocence of the Member, but is intended to allow the Public Prosecutor's Office to investigate the charge against Béla Kovács concerning the crime of espionage against the European Union under Section 261/A of Law C of 2012 of the Hungarian Criminal Code.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. It is not necessary to determine whether the statements of the Hungarian Advocate General, Dr Polt, or the contrary statements of Mr Béla Kovacs, can be believed. It cannot be ruled out that the above-mentioned grounds of extradition are of political origin. That is why I am abstaining from voting.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The request concerns the lifting of the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovacs, a Hungarian MEP and member of the far-right Jobbik party. Legal proceedings were launched against him in Hungary in 2014. According to classified information, which is widely circulated in the Hungarian press, he is suspected of spying in favour of Russia and the European Union. In view of the suspicions about the case and the organized leaks against him, I am inclined to abstain. However, Parliament considered itself incompetent when it came to espionage practiced and proven by Germany! Why would it be competent on cases, supposed, and therefore without evidence, of espionage practiced, moreover, by a single individual. I abstain to avoid the malice of the anti-Russian pack of this Parliament and the media. In fact, I do not believe for a second that Russia needs a figure as grotesque as a far-right Hungarian MP to spy on the European Union already spied on by the United States and the German government without anyone finding fault with it.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. Hungarian MEP Béla Kovacs is accused of spying on the Russian Federation. Mr. Béla Kovacs pays for his patriotic commitment and is no more or less a victim of political persecution. Parliamentary immunity is a democratic tradition, the crumbling of which in recent times speaks volumes about the liberticidal state of the EU. The congresswoman voted against it.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the request for the waiver of the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovács, Member of the European Parliament, since the request was made in order that investigations can be carried out, on the basis of reasonable suspicions, to see whether a charge will lie against him with regard to the offence of espionage against the institutions of the European Union under Section 261/A of Act C of 2012 on the Hungarian Criminal Code. According to that Section, any person who conducts intelligence activities for a non-European Union third country against the European Parliament, the European Commission or the Council of the European Union shall be punishable in accordance with Section 261, paragraph 1 of which provides that any person who conducts intelligence activities for a foreign power or foreign organisation against Hungary is guilty of a felony punishable by a term of imprisonment of between two and eight years. That is why I have voted in favour of waiving the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovács

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The Democratic Coalition welcomes the fact that the Legal Committee of the European Parliament proposed on Monday the waiver of the immunity of Béla Kovács, a jobbikos MEP. The right-wing MEP has been the face of extremely serious allegations, which cannot be thoroughly investigated. As MEP for the DK, I therefore vote to waive the immunity of Béla Kovács in today's plenary session of the European Parliament. I am convinced that, in the light of the serious spying cases, there is room for a thorough investigation, an independent judicial procedure.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. The Hungarian Jobbik MP, Béla Kovacs, is accused, without evidence, of spying on Russia and Parliament is asking for his immunity to be lifted so that he can be brought to justice. This is an obvious political persecution to which we cannot support.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This text relates to a request by the Hungarian Attorney General for the lifting of parliamentary immunity against MP Kovacs. The latter is suspected of spying on behalf of the Russian Federation against the EU institutions. However, it cannot be entirely ruled out that this procedure should be of a political nature, given the certain Euroscepticism of the Member in question, as well as the forced Russophobia of the European authorities. What about the espionage carried out by the German services towards France for the benefit of the United States? This opening of inquiry shows that European minds remained frozen in the 1980s, when the Cold War ended almost 25 years ago. That is why I voted against this waiver of immunity.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of lifting the parliamentary immunity of Béla Kovacs. Any request made to the President of the European Parliament by the authorities of a Member State to waive a Member's immunity is heard by the relevant parliamentary committee. I voted in accordance with the opinion of this committee.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this report on the basis of the evaluation made by the JURI Committee.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. The report deals with the waiver of the immunity of Mr Béla Kovacs. In principle, I am in favour of waiving immunity. In this particular case, however, I do not see the allegations sufficiently proven. That is why I abstained.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Given the importance of carrying out investigations aimed at clarifying the events in which Béla Kovács is suspected of spying against the European institutions and given the sensitivity of the case, I thought it appropriate to vote in favour.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. This text relates to a request by the Hungarian Attorney General for the lifting of parliamentary immunity against MP Kovacs. The latter is suspected of spying on behalf of the Russian Federation against the EU institutions. However, it cannot be entirely ruled out that this procedure should be of a political nature, given the certain Euroscepticism of the Member in question, as well as the forced Russophobia of the European authorities. What about the espionage carried out by the German services towards France for the benefit of the United States? This opening of inquiry shows that European minds remained frozen in the 1980s, when the Cold War ended almost 25 years ago. That is why I voted against this waiver of immunity.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ I support a recommendation by my colleague Zwiefka which, after a long deliberation, decides to lift the immunity of my colleague Kovacz since there is no reason to assume in this case, i.e. serious and reasonable enough suspicion, that the application for waiver of immunity has been submitted in connection with proceedings brought with the intention of causing political harm to the mp concerned (fumus persecutionis). In that case, I consider it most appropriate for a Representative to participate fully with the competent judicial authorities in the continuation of the case without the implications of its final outcome.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. – The Hungarian Attorney General has requested the waiver of the immunity of Representative Béla Kovács so that a reasonable suspicion can be investigated smoothly and to determine whether he will be charged with a crime of espionage to the detriment of the Institutions of the European Union pursuant to Article 261/A of Law C of 2012 on the Hungarian Criminal Code. According to that Article, a person carrying out intelligence activities for a country which is not a member of the European Union and to the detriment of the European Parliament, the European Commission or the Council of the European Union may be punished in accordance with Article 261 TE. The investigation will be conducted by the Office of the Central Attorney General's Office for Investigations and the constitutional tasks will be carried out independently of external organisations and acted in accordance with the presumption of innocence.  In view of this and the fact that there is no reasonable doubt that the application for the waiver of immunity was submitted with the intention of causing political harm to the Mp (fumus persecutionis), I support the report of my colleague Tadeusz Zwiefka.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of waiving the immunity of Mep Béla Kovács. I believe that the Hungarian Attorney-General should be allowed to carry out the appropriate investigations in order to determine whether or not there may be an allegation of the crime of espionage against the European institutions. In any case, I would like to stress that my vote in favour of such a revocation does not involve a judgment as to the guilt or innocence of the Member.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. The Hungarian Attorney General has requested the waiver of the immunity of a Member of the European Parliament, Béla Kovács, in order to open an investigation on the basis of reasonable suspicions with a view to determining whether he is charged with espionage against the institutions of the European Union under Section 261/A of Law C 2012 on the Hungarian Penal Code. According to the report of the Committee on Legal Affairs, no evidence of fumus persecutionis has been found, i.e. a sufficiently serious and reasoned suspicion that, at the origin of the request for waiver of immunity, a procedure is underway with the aim of undermining the political activity of the Member. Accordingly, and on the basis of that report, I voted in favour of this Decision to lift the immunity of Mr Kovács.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the lifting of Mr Béla Kovacs' immunity, so that the Hungarian justice system could carry out its work, with strict respect for the rights of the defence, considering that the alleged facts - accusations of espionage against the institutions of the European Union - can, in any event, give rise to a criminal investigation, without prejudging the guilt or innocence of the Member. It is essential that justice be able to shed light on this particularly sensitive and potentially harmful case in more ways than one.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 As part of an investigation by the Central Department of Investigation and Criminal Action of Hungary, Attorney General Péter Polt requested the waiver of the immunity of Mep Béla Kovács on the basis of reasonable suspicions of espionage against the institutions of the European Union. The outcome of the investigation shows that Mr Kovács' contacts with Russian intelligence agents were first discovered in 2010 by the Hungarian Constitution Protection Service. It is certain that, for legal purposes, the request for waiver of immunity, in this case, is restricted to facts occurring after 1 January 2014 and must be subject to the conditions set out in Article 9(6) of the Rules of Procedure, I agree with the waiver of parliamentary immunity, since it is limited to criminal proceedings and has no objective of prejudice to the political activity of Mr Béla Kovács.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. I abstained in this pleading for suspension of immunity. Although I understand that Béla Kovács does not represent in any case the values expected of this House, I also understand that the suspension of immunity cannot be equated to a political trial, so I abstained in this case.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of suspending immunity to Béla Kovács as it is clearly a case of political persecution. The suspension of the immunity of an elected office so that it can deal with legal proceedings cannot be used as a political weapon against Members of the European Parliament. This is a clear case of instrumentalisation of this, which is why I did not vote in favour of suspending his immunity.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: Written. ‒ This explanation of the vote comes as a criticism of the existing system of evaluation of the work of MEMBERS of the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities potentiated in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and most of all the success of parliamentary action.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the resolution to waive the immunity of MEP Béla Kovács because the Attorney General of Hungary requested the waiver of immunity on the basis of reasonable suspicions for the crime of espionage against the EU institutions. In view of the fact that this is a very serious crime, it was important to waive the immunity of a Member so that the inquiry could prove the guilt or innocence of Béla Kovács. As a general rule, the European Parliament shall, at the request of the national authorities, always waive the immunity of a Member unless it is proven that there is an intention to harm the Member concerned politically. Although Béla Kovács defended himself before the Committee on Legal Affairs, the committee decided that parliament should waive the immunity of the appointee, which the EP also accepted.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒ I supported this report on the grounds that the Hungarian Attorney General requested the waiver of immunity so that members of The White Kovacs could be investigated undisturbed for suspected crimes of espionage to the detriment of the Institutions of the European Union in accordance with Article 261/A of Law C of 2012 on the Hungarian Criminal Code. Since this request is in accordance with the case-law of the Supreme Court in Hungary, which ruled in Bf.I.2782/2002 that parliamentary immunity is limited to criminal proceedings and does not extend to measures not governed by the Criminal Procedure Act aimed at preventing or detecting or pointing to a criminal offence.  Further in the case, there is no presumption, i.e. reasonable doubt, that the application was made in relation to proceedings brought with the intention of causing political harm to the Representative.

name: Richard SULÍK
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the proposal as the acts for which Béla Kovács is to be investigated have no direct connection with the performance of his duties as a Member of the European Parliament.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 This case is an unprecedented form of political persecution based on a photographic law on alleged espionage against the European Parliament. The Orbán Government is the only one in the EU that has politicised a non-existent offence, that of espionage against the EU, with the sole aim of beating its political opponents.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. I voted to lift Bela Kovacs' immunity so that the MEP could explain himself to the authorities in his country.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of uplifting the parliamentary immunity of Hungarian MEP Béla Kovács. The waiver was requested so that the Central Chief Prosecution Office of Hungary could carry out an investigation on the basis of reasonable suspicions, to see whether a charge will lie against him with regard to the offence of espionage against the institutions of the European Union under Section 261/A of Act C of 2012 on the Hungarian Criminal Code. The suspicion was raised by Mr Kovács alleged covert contacts with Russian intelligence officers. Parliament agreed that there was no suspicion that the matter is being raised with the intention of causing political damage to Mr Kovács.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. – I supported the lifting of the immunity of Hungarian MEP Béla Kovács so that an investigation could be carried out into the possible commission of a espionage offence to the detriment of the Institutions of the European Union. Namely, his initial hidden contacts with Russian intelligence were observed back in 2010, but under the Hungarian Penal Code, the lifting of immunity is solely required for events that occurred after 1 January 2014.  Since the hearing at the Committee on Legal Affairs and the exchange of views with the Hungarian Attorney General found that the investigation was not politically motivated or had no direct or obvious connection to his or her performance as a Member of the European Parliament, I voted to lift the immunity.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. I supported the request for the waiver of Béla Kovács's parliamentary immunity, as I believe that an investigation could be carried out on the basis of a reasonable suspicion to determine whether, in accordance with Section 261/A of Act C of 2012 on the Hungarian Penal Code, the accused is charged with a proven crime of espionage against the institutions of the European Union.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. I abstained in this pleading for suspension of immunity. Although I understand that Béla Kovács does not represent in any case the values expected of this House, I also understand that the suspension of immunity cannot be equated to a political trial, so I abstained in this case.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. I abstained in this pleading for suspension of immunity. Although I understand that Béla Kovács does not represent in any case the values expected of this House, I also understand that the suspension of immunity cannot be equated to a political trial, so I abstained in this case.

name: Ángela VALLINA
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of suspending immunity to Béla Kovács as it is clearly a case of political persecution. The suspension of the immunity of an elected office so that it can deal with legal proceedings cannot be used as a political weapon against Members of the European Parliament. This is a clear case of instrumentalisation of this, which is why I did not vote in favour of suspending his immunity.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. The Hungarian Attorney General has requested the waiver of the immunity of Mep Béla Kovács in order to open an investigation on the basis of reasonable suspicions in order to determine whether he is charged with espionage against the institutions of the European Union. We have doubts as to the nature and motivations of this request by the Hungarian authorities. Hence our abstention.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. It is not necessary to determine whether the statements of the Hungarian Advocate General, Dr Polt, or the contrary statements of Mr Béla Kovacs, can be believed. It cannot be ruled out that the above-mentioned grounds of extradition are of political origin. That is why I am abstaining from voting.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of the candidate for Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, because her professional career is closely related to infrastructure investment projects. This path is giving a clear signal of the potential direction that EIE investments will take, which will seek to replace public investments in infrastructure with public-private consortia that in the long run are much more expensive for taxpayers. In addition, he was the only candidate presented by the Council, which is a procedure that leaves much to be desired for the democratic will expressed by the European Parliament. That's why I haven't been able to vote for him.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. I voted against the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the European Strategic Investment Fund (EFSI). Indeed, the EFSI (also known as the Juncker Plan) has just been created by the President of the Commission to strengthen projects favourable to the European Union.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ This vote is by secret ballot: I do not believe in the principle of a secret ballot here. Members of the public have the right to know how their democratically elected representatives voted. Therefore I wish to clarify, for the record, that I voted against – on the grounds that I do not support the European Fund for Strategic Investment, rather than any wish to make a value judgement in respect of the candidate.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. The EIB shall appoint the Executive Director of the EFSI with the consent of the European Parliament. October 13, 2015 The Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Iliyana Tsanova, nominated as the candidate for the post of Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI. I support the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. The vote was by secret ballot, but it's easy to guess mine.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I have approved Ms. Tsanova's appointment as Deputy Director of the EFSI.  This is, of course, an essential function for the implementation of the EFSI, which includes job creation.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the proposal to appoint Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments. Mrs Tsanova has already won the hearing of the Committee on Budgets and Parliament's Committee on Economic Affairs and answered the questions successfully asked, showing her worth for the office assigned to her. I wish you a good career in your new work.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. As with the previous recommendation, this vote should allow the appointment of Ms Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments. I voted against this appointment, not wanting to endorse European policy and this body.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. At a joint hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs and the Committee on Budgets, Ms Tsanova was able to demonstrate that she was eligible for office and clearly show her competence for the post of Deputy Director-General of EIESI. That is why I voted in favour of your appointment.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report, in which the European Parliament supports the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI). In particular, the proposal for the appointment of the Efsi Executive Director and the Deputy Executive Director was adopted by the EFSI Management Board on 2 October 2015 and forwarded this proposal to the European Parliament. Then, in the European Parliament on 13 October 2015. The Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Iliyana Tsanova, the nominee for the post of Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI, during which the candidate gave an introductory speech and then answered questions from committee members. During the plenary session of the European Parliament, her nomination was accepted.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting against. I am sceptical about the functionality and usefulness of the Juncker plan, regardless of the Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this report as I have a number of concerns with the EFSI Plan and I believe that many of its provisions are fundamentally flawed.  The plan contains no provision in which to boost public investment, and for the most part the EFSI is a pilot project dressed up as a structural fund. There is no real increase in funds being made available. It is simply picking up money that the European Budget and the EIB had already allocated to attract private investment, weakening its legal framework and thereby increasing the exposure of public resources in the interests of the private sector. The EFSI, with sufficient political will and a commitment to boost public investment, could be used as a positive tool for much—needed investment. Unfortunately, no such commitment has been displayed and as it stands this project is merely style over substance.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against the appointment of a Deputy Managing Director as we do not support the EU’s EFSI programme or any posts created for it. This ‘European Fund for Strategic Investment’ seeks to raise EUR 315 billion, but is based on taxpayers’ money being used as a guarantee and on wafer—thin assumptions on how much private businesses will put in. It is another grand EU project that will cost billions.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I vote in favour of this report because I believe that Iliyana Tsanova has the experience and the right credentials for the post of Deputy Managing Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 As in the case of the Director-General of EFSI, I voted against the proposed candidacy for the role of Deputy Director-General. My vote against, in addition to reiterating my opposition to the Juncker plan and the EFSI approach, also expresses a disagreement with the figure indicated who, at the hearing on 13 October, showed that he did not have adequate competences.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 Having regard to the proposal of the Governing Council of the European Fund for Strategic Investments of 2 October 2015 on the appointment of the Deputy Executive Director and participating in and attending the hearing in the Committee on Budgets, we approve the appointment of the Deputy Director to the EFSI.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments. Article 7(6) of Regulation (EU) No 2015/1017 provides for the Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI) to be appointed by the EIB, subject to authorisation by the European Parliament, following open and transparent selection. On 2 October 2015, the EFSI Steering Committee adopted a proposal on the appointment of the Deputy Director-General of EFSI and forwarded it to the European Parliament. On 13 October 2015, the Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing of the candidate proposed for the role of Deputy Director-General of EFSI, Iliyana Tsanova.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I congratulate Dr. Iliyana Tsanova on the appointment. I voted in favour because I felt that she was fit for office, but I do not intend to give her carte blanche at all: her commitment must be directed towards the development of the European economy and it is on the basis of this that, at the end of her term of office, she will have to be judged. For the time being, I wish you well in your work.

name: David COBURN
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against the appointment of a Deputy Managing Director as we do not support the EU’s EFSI programme or any posts created for it. This ‘European Fund for Strategic Investment’ seeks to raise EUR 315 billion, but is based on taxpayers’ money being used as a guarantee and on wafer—thin assumptions on how much private businesses will put in. It is another grand EU project that will cost billions.

name: Jane COLLINS
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against the appointment of a Deputy Managing Director as we do not support the EU’s EFSI programme or any posts created for it. This ‘European Fund for Strategic Investment’ seeks to raise EUR 315 billion, but is based on taxpayers’ money being used as a guarantee and on wafer—thin assumptions on how much private businesses will put in. It is another grand EU project that will cost billions.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 I congratulate Iliyana Tsanova on her appointment to the prestigious role of Deputy Director-General of EFSI and wish her well in her work.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 This is the proposal for the appointment of the Deputy Director-General of EFSI, in accordance with Article 7 of the EFSI Regulation, which provides for the appointment by the EIB, subject to the approval of the European Parliament (following an open and transparent selection procedure in accordance with the EIB's procedures, during which the European Parliament should be duly informed, in a timely manner , at all stages). In fact, the selection process has not been particularly clear, let alone transparent, and that is why I am voting against it.

name: Tamás DEUTSCH
text: Writing. – Article 7(6) of Regulation (EU) No 2015/1017 provides that the Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of the EIB shall be appointed by the EIB following an open and transparent selection procedure in accordance with EIB procedures and after approval by the European Parliament. On 2 October 2015, the ESII Steering Committee adopted a proposal for the appointment of the Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of the SII, which it forwarded to the European Parliament. On 13 October 2015, the Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Iliyana Tsanova, the candidate proposed for the position of Deputy Executive Director of the ESIF, who made an introductory statement and answered questions put by the members of the Committee. The European Parliament approved the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the ESI. On the basis of the above, the Hungarian People's Party delegation supported the adoption of the proposal in line with the European People's Party.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 We consider mocking the "election" of a person without a co-candidate. Such election systems apply in North Korea.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The Executive Director and the Deputy Executive Director shall be appointed by the EIB after approval by the European Parliament following an open and transparent selection procedure, in line with EIB procedures, and the EFSI Governing Board itself has approved a proposal for the appointment of the Executive Director and the Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI, which it has forwarded to the European Parliament. On 13 October 2015, the Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held the hearings of Wilhelm Molterer, proposed candidate for the functions of Executive Director of the EFSI, and Iliyana Tsanova, proposed candidate for the duties of Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI.  Both candidates demonstrated competence, extensive professional experience and excellent knowledge of the EFSI.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I do not support the appointment of the Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI as, in the absence of another candidate, that person is in fact appointed and not elected. In other words, it is a person who is settled and appointed. Such election systems apply in North Korea.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of approving the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova for the position of Deputy Managing Director of the EFSI.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. The only candidate proposed has been Bulgarian economist Iliyana Tsanova and, despite her extensive experience, I voted against her precisely with the development and infrastructure sector (European Bank for Reconstruction and Development), a land to which THE EEF will engage, and for the risks of conflict of interest that could arise.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the candidacy of Ms Iliyana Tsanova.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for the report on the proposal for the appointment of the Deputy Managing Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments. Having regard to the proposal of the Steering Board of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI) of 2 October 2015 for the appointment of its Deputy Managing Director, having regard to Article 7(6) of Regulation (EU) 2015/1017 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 June 2015 on the European Fund for Strategic Investments, the European Investment Advisory Hub and the European Investment Project Portal and amending Regulations (EU) No 1291/2013 and (EU) No 1316/2013 – the European Fund for Strategic Investments. Due to the regulations being followed and the trust expressed to the candidate, I voted for the approval of the appointment.

name: András GYÜRK
text: Writing. \u2012 Article 7(6) of Regulation (EU) No 2015/1017 provides that the Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of the EIB shall be appointed by the EIB following an open and transparent selection procedure in accordance with EIB procedures and after approval by the European Parliament. On 2 October 2015, the ESII Steering Committee adopted a proposal for the appointment of the Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of the SII, which it forwarded to the European Parliament. On 13 October 2015, the Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Iliyana Tsanova, the candidate proposed for the position of Deputy Executive Director of the ESIF, who made an introductory statement and answered questions put by the members of the Committee. The European Parliament approved the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the ESI. On the basis of the above, the Hungarian People's Party delegation supported the adoption of the proposal in line with the European People's Party.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. The only candidate proposed has been Bulgarian economist Iliyana Tsanova and, despite her extensive experience, I voted against her precisely with the development and infrastructure sector (European Bank for Reconstruction and Development), a land to which THE EEF will engage, and for the risks of conflict of interest that could arise.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the Proposal for a Decision of the European Parliament on the proposal for the appointment of a Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, as I believe that Ms Iliyana Tsanova has the necessary knowledge and skills to serve as Deputy Director-General. Her experience in managing European funds can certainly contribute to the consistent and effective performance of the function in question. Also, the international experience gained further strengthens its choice, which I therefore support.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. I voted against it.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the report by my colleagues Jean Arthuis and Roberto Gualtieri on the appointment of the Deputy Director General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, which funds the Juncker Plan. This text approves the application proposed by the European Investment Bank for this position. This appointment was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. The primary objective of EFSI is to lift Europe out of the crisis through strategic investments. Consequently, I believe it is essential to exploit the liquidity available to financial institutions, businesses and individuals. In view of this, the presence at the top of figures with a high degree of professionalism is a priority. For these reasons, I welcome the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Director-General of EFSI.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of the candidate for Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, because her professional career is closely related to infrastructure investment projects. This path is giving a clear signal of the potential direction that EIE investments will take, which will seek to replace public investments in infrastructure with public-private consortia that in the long run are much more expensive for taxpayers. In addition, he was the only candidate presented by the Council, which is a procedure that leaves much to be desired for the democratic will expressed by the European Parliament. That's why I haven't been able to vote for him.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ The European Commission has created the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI) with the aim of mobilising funding in cooperation with the European Investment Bank (EIB), with the aim of investing in riskier projects in the fields of research, innovation, energy, transport and social infrastructure, education and science. It is stipulated that the Deputy Director-General is appointed by the EIB after approval by the European Parliament. The Fund's Steering Board submitted to Parliament a proposal to appoint Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Director-General. I supported the appointment of Iliyana Tsaova as Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: Writing. \u2012 As in the case of the Managing Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, I support the appointment of Ms Ilijana Canova as Deputy Managing Director of the EFSI. The European Union needs professionals whose work will contribute to the successful development of our economy.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on the proposal to appoint the Deputy Executive Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, because I do not agree with this proposal.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I support the proposed appointment of IIiyana Tsanova as the new Deputy Director-General of EFSI, an important role for which commitment and expertise are needed.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 With my vote in favour I have expressed my agreement to the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Director General, confident that her professional experience and personal skills are suitable for this position.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. EFSI is an illusory project that is not feasible. Since the whole project must be rejected, I cannot support the proposed deputy managing director either.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. This vote concerns the appointment of the Deputy Director General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI).  There is only one candidate: Bulgarian economist Iliyana Tsanova, who has specialized in the development of public-private partnerships. I'm voting against it. She should have been nominated as a director in place of the proposed incumbent, but the machismo and tenderness for the far right are the strongest in the European prebendes system. I'm voting against it.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. I extend my congratulations to Mrs Iliyana Tsanova, Bulgarian economist, for her new role as Deputy Executive Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments. This is a key position in the implementation of the Juncker Plan, which aims to return to growth and create jobs.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I support the nomination of the Deputy Managing Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments because I believe that Iliyana Tsanova is a good candidate for this position.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report on the proposal to appoint the Deputy Executive Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI). The relevant parliamentary committees approved the candidacy of Iliyana Tsanova, presented by the European Investment Bank. I voted in accordance with the opinion of these committees.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for the appointment of the Deputy Managing Director of EFSI based on the evaluation and the discussion in the Budgets Committee.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. I have abstained from voting in this candidacy, as I am extremely critical of the EFSI, the European Fund for Strategic Investments, and have also voted against its establishment.

name: Margot PARKER
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against the appointment of a Deputy Managing Director as we do not support the EU’s EFSI programme or any posts created for it. This ‘European Fund for Strategic Investment’ seeks to raise EUR 315 billion, but is based on taxpayers’ money being used as a guarantee and on wafer—thin assumptions on how much private businesses will put in. It is another grand EU project that will cost billions.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Ladies and gentlemen, on the basis of iliyana Tsanova's expertise and experience, I am convinced that she is the right person to hold that position and help Europe to start again, taking advantage of a fundamental instrument such as strategic investments. I assure you of my full confidence and that I will vote in favour of it.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ The current state of the EU economy and a decline in investment compared to 2007 of around 15%, as well as a slow recovery due to insufficient investment momentum, have a negative impact on growth potential, productivity, employment and job creation. The European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI) is a key lever of the Juncker Investment Plan, but also of this term between the European Commission and Parliament in launching the European economy and further strengthening it. Appointing the heads of the Fund to manage €330 billion to €410 billion is a very important decision. I welcome and support the decision authorising the appointment of the Deputy Director of the EFSI by the European Parliament. I wish Mrs. Ilijana Can's much success in her work, to be helpful to the director in performing his responsible function. I am particularly pleased that a woman from the eastern part of Europe comes to this place, with a good foundation of education in the environment of a thriving economy of the Western European and American type. I hope that her experience so far at the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and work on infrastructure development projects in the Western Balkans will contribute to understanding the real problems encountered by the East of Europe and that this experience will help to better channel the Fund's funds into the best projects in this part of Europe.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ As the Committee on Budgets and the Economic and Monetary Policy Committee on 13 October 2013 On 1 October 2015, iliyana Tsanova, the proposed candidate for the post of Deputy Director-General of efsius, held a keynote speech and then answered questions from committee members and at which Ms Tsanova received the support of the committee responsible, I support her appointment to this extremely important function and wish her success in her future work to justify the support shown.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. - It is required that the Director-General and Deputy Director-General of the EFSI be appointed by the EIB after approval by the European Parliament and after an open and transparent selection procedure in accordance with EIB procedures. On 13 October 2015, the Committee on Budgets and the Economic and Monetary Policy Committee held a hearing of Iliyana Tsanova, the proposed candidate for the post of Deputy Director-General of the EFSI, at which she gave a keynote speech and then answered questions from committee members.  I believe that the proposed candidate, Iliyana Tsanova, has the expertise, experience and excellent knowledge of efsius, and therefore I support the report of fellow MEPs Jean Arthuis and Robert Gualtieri on the proposal for the appointment of a Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 Following today's vote, I hope that the new Deputy Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI), Iliyana Tsanova, can start working to help provide an immediate stimulus to the European Union's economic recovery. In order to overcome the current difficulties, it is necessary to implement a financing plan for the implementation of strategic investments which the Member States and the European productive sector consider to be priorities. I wish the new Deputy Director well in his work, in the hope that he will be able to play his role with the utmost independence and transparency.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. The European Parliament has approved the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments. This vote reflects the position of the ECON and BUDG committees of Parliament which approved this appointment in advance.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. \u2012 Having taken into account the proposal of the Governing Board of the European Fund for Strategic Investments (EFSI) of 2 October 2015, with regard to the appointment of its Deputy Executive Director, as well as the joint deliberations of the Committee on Budgets and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, delivered following the hearing of the candidate proposed to carry out those duties, I voted in favour of appointing Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against the appointment of a Deputy Managing Director as we do not support the EU’s EFSI programme or any posts created for it. This ‘European Fund for Strategic Investment’ seeks to raise EUR 315 billion, but is based on taxpayers’ money being used as a guarantee and on wafer—thin assumptions on how much private businesses will put in. It is another grand EU project that will cost billions.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the candidacy of Mrs Iliyana Tsanova (Bulgaria, currently Director of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development - EBRD) as Deputy Director of the EFSI. Ms. Tsanova had been pre-auditioned and her candidacy selected by the parliamentary committees ECON and BUDG.  This designation, as well as that of the Executive Director, allow the Juncker Fund to officially start launching the projects.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 The appointment of Executive Director and Deputy Executive Director of the European Strategic Investment Fund is made by the European Investment Bank, according to criteria of accuracy and transparency. Having submitted a proposal from the EFSI Governing Board on 2 October 2015 and the selection process has been carried out in an open and transparent manner, I agree with the appointment of Iliyana Tsanova as Deputy Executive Director of the EFSI, since, at a hearing in the Budget Committees and the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs , demonstrated competence and proven professional experience for the full performance of these functions.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I agree to appoint Iliyana Tsanova as deputy director of the European Fund for Strategic Investments as Article 7, paragraph 6 of Regulation (EU) No 2015/1017 provides for the Deputy Director-General of EFSI to be appointed by the European Investment Bank, subject to parliament's approval, following an open and transparent selection procedure in accordance with EIB procedures, during which the European Parliament is informed of all stages leading to the choice of appointment of the candidate.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. The only candidate proposed has been Bulgarian economist Iliyana Tsanova and, despite her extensive experience, I voted against her precisely with the development and infrastructure sector (European Bank for Reconstruction and Development), a land to which THE EEF will engage, and for the risks of conflict of interest that could arise.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. I have not been able to vote in favour of the candidate for Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, because her professional career is closely related to infrastructure investment projects. This path is giving a clear signal of the potential direction that EIE investments will take, which will seek to replace public investments in infrastructure with public-private consortia that in the long run are much more expensive for taxpayers. In addition, he was the only candidate presented by the Council, which is a procedure that leaves much to be desired for the democratic will expressed by the European Parliament. That's why I haven't been able to vote for him.

name: Jill SEYMOUR
text: in writing. ‒ I do not support the addition of new EU posts, and therefore I do not support this position.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: Written. ‒ This explanation of the vote comes as a criticism of the existing system of evaluation of the work of MEMBERS of the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities potentiated in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and most of all the success of parliamentary action.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. I support the decision to appoint Iliyana Tsanova, the proposed candidate for the post of Deputy Director-General of EFSI, as iliyana Tsanova stands out as an appropriate candidate for Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. ‒ The Director-General and Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments shall be appointed by the EIB, following the approval of the European Parliament, as required by Article 7(6) of the EIA. Regulation (EU) 2015/1017. On 2 October 2015, the Steering Board of the European Fund for Strategic Investments adopted a proposal for the appointment of the Director-General and Deputy Director-General of the EFSI and forwarded this proposal to the European Parliament. On 13 October 2015, the Committee on Budgets and the Economic and Monetary Policy Committee held a hearing of Iliyana Tsanova, the proposed candidate for the post of Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments, where she gave a keynote speech and then answered questions from committee members.  On this basis, the European Parliament approves the appointment of Iliyana Tsarov as Deputy Director-General of the EFSI and instructs its President to forward this decision to the Council, the Commission, the European Investment Bank and the governments of the Member States. Following the approval of the European Parliament and following an open and transparent selection procedure in line with EIB procedures, which the European Parliament is informed about in a timely and at all stages of the process, I fully support the proposal to appoint Iliyan Tsanov as Deputy Director-General of the European Fund for Strategic Investments.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: Writing. \u2012 We consider the "election" of a person without co-candidates undemocratic.

name: Marc TARABELLA
